artist: Toyohara Kunichika; Publisher: Fukuda Kumajirō; Carver: Umezawa Minokichi
creditline: Gift of Willard and Elizabeth Clark
dimension: 41 3/4 × 9 7/8 in. (106.05 × 25.08 cm) (sheet, vertical ōban, upright triptych)
inscription: 「浅山鉄山 市川団十郎」「お菊霊 尾上菊五郎」「岩渕忠太 尾上松助」「中間蟻助 尾上菊四郎」 {Asayama Tessan, Ichikawa Danjūrō; Okiku-rei, Onoe Kikugorō; Iwabuchi Chūta, Onoe Matsusuke; Chūgen Arisuke, Onoe Kikushirō} (Ichikawa Danjūrō IX as Asayama Tessan, Onoe Kikugorō V as Okiku's ghost, Onoe Matsusuke IV as Iwabuchi Chūta, Onoe Kikushirō III as Chugen Arisuke)
life_date: Toyohara Kunichika, Japanese, 1835–1900; Fukuda Kumajirō, Publisher, Japanese; Umezawa Minokichi, Carver, Japanese
markings: Red circular seal at base of oblong cartouche LRQ; Publisher's seal in fish form; 梅澤刀
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper, mounted as a scroll
title: Applying Make-up with a Mirror at the Mansion of the Plates, Kabuki Theater
